title: Drawing, "The Elevation of a Silver or Silver Gilt Tureen", ca. 1750
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and gouache,  watercolor on  off-white laid paper
markings: Strasburg lily over J H (symbol--see card for exact representation) Z.
provenance: From the Collection of Giovanni Piancastelli. Purchased from the general funds from Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee.
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: The left half suggests a much richer decoration--with rocaille and floral motifs--than the right one. The handle at left is composed of scrolls and a sea harp, the right one of scrolls and a shell. Two putti hold an escutcheon on top of the cover.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "The Elevation of a Silver or Silver Gilt Tureen", ca. 1750.
ca. 1750. Pen and brown ink, brush and gouache,  watercolor on  off-white laid paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-6003.
